meanings.definition: Phreaks (noun): People who manipulate or exploit telecommunications systems for fun or profit.
meanings.sent1: The group of phreaks gathered to discuss their latest exploits in hacking phone lines.
meanings.sent2: Many phreaks were arrested for illegally accessing phone networks.
meanings.sent3: The phreaks jokingly referred to themselves as 'telecom wizards'.
meanings.sent4: In the world of telecommunications, phreaks were the modern-day pirates.
meanings.sent5: The image of phreaks huddled around a computer screen was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: Phreaks (verb): To engage in the activity of hacking or manipulating telecommunications systems.
meanings.sent1: He phreaks into the phone system to make free long-distance calls.
meanings.sent2: She phreaks late into the night, exploring different ways to bypass security measures.
meanings.sent3: The teenager phreaks with excitement as he successfully bypasses the network firewall.
meanings.sent4: The hacker phreaks through the digital barriers with ease.
meanings.sent5: Phreaks away, the young man felt a rush of adrenaline as he outsmarted the system.

meanings.definition: Phreaks (adjective): Describing something related to the subculture of phone hacking or manipulation.
meanings.sent1: The phreaks community was buzzing with news of the latest security breach.
meanings.sent2: She wore a t-shirt with a phreaks logo, proudly displaying her affiliation with the group.
meanings.sent3: The phreaks convention was a mix of technology and mischief.
meanings.sent4: His phreaks skills were unmatched in the underground world of hacking.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with phreaks memorabilia, showcasing the history of phone hacking culture.
